column1: English Literature: Literature and Modernity 1900 to present MSc
column3: School of Literatures, Languages and Cultures
column5: Programme descriptionThis programme examines a range of literary and theoretical contexts, introducing ways that writing and imagination shape and share in cultural and political processes.You will explore the ways literature since 1900 has sought to change and modernise itself, in the context of wider developments of modernity characterising the age.Your studies will take you through a broad and fascinating field, from the originators of literary ‘modernity’ – including TS Eliot, Ezra Pound, James Joyce and Virginia Woolf – to the present day and the continuing impact of their innovations.
